page.title: 03ABERDYFI WHARF AND JETTY
page.content: During the summer months the pretty wharf and jetty area is a hive of activity.Attractively located in the village centre it looks out across the busy estuary towards Borth.It also provides the many young visitors to the resort with a perfect spot from which to enjoy crabbing. It continues to be dominated by two large wooden buildings originally built as storage sheds but now occupied by the Outward Bound School and the R.N.L.I.inshore rescue boat.A small sailing museum is also housed in these buildings. Redeveloped in the late 1960's it gained a Prince of Wales Award for Environmental Improvement and now boasts an Information Centre,public shelter,Harbour Masters Office,public toilets,neatly laid out gardens and the Dovey Sailing Club's clubhouse.
